page.title: 07Interview with a blacksmith.
page.content: { Mr Macleod, you are a {blacksmith.What does that involve? I have a forge where I make peat irons ornamental wrought iron goods such as gates and railings, but most of my work involves welding. {What kind of welding work do you do? Agricultural machinery mainly. I weld digger buckets, booms etc. I also straighten iron and metal such as tractor stays. {What fuel do you use in the forge? Coal dross mainly. {Do you employ anyone? No, I work on my own. {Is your workshop at home? No it is in Stornoway, 5 minutes drive away. {What hours do you work? I work from 8 till 6, but if I'm busy I go back in the evening and work till about 10 p.m.
